p: Nonetheless, antagonist results arise frequently: whilst many papers described its anticancer properties [ 7, 8], others surprisingly claim A. vera is indeed carcinogenic over a specific dose [ 9] or alert that specific compounds present in Aloe may be highly toxic if not taken under caution [ 10]. One reason for this could be the overall misidentification of the Aloe genus species, since current research supports that there are Aloe species that have more potent bioactivities than Aloe vera [ 11].
